info.title: HubDB endpoints
info.description:
HubDB is a relational data store that presents data as rows, columns, and cells in a table, much like a spreadsheet. HubDB tables can be added or modified [in the HubSpot CMS](https://knowledge.hubspot.com/cos-general/how-to-edit-hubdb-tables), but you can also use the API endpoints documented here. For more information on HubDB tables and using their data on a HubSpot site, see the [CMS developers site](https://designers.hubspot.com/docs/tools/hubdb). You can also see the [documentation for dynamic pages](https://designers.hubspot.com/docs/tutorials/how-to-build-dynamic-pages-with-hubdb) for more details about the `useForPages` field.

HubDB tables support `draft` and `published` versions. This allows you to update data in the table, either for testing or to allow for a manual approval process, without affecting any live pages using the existing data. Draft data can be reviewed, and published by a user working in HubSpot or published via the API. Draft data can also be discarded, allowing users to go back to the published version of the data without disrupting it. If a table is set to be `allowed for public access`, you can access the published version of the table and rows without any authentication by specifying the portal id via the query parameter `portalId`.

get.summary: Get login activity for a HubSpot account.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The cursor token value to get the next set of results. You can get this from the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to display per page. Max value of limit is 200.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Identifier of user to retrieve activities for

get.summary: Get account details for a HubSpot account.
Get the daily API usage and limits for a HubSpot account.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to display per page.

get.summary: Get security activity for a HubSpot account

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The cursor token value to get the next set of results. You can get this from the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to display per page. Max value of limit is 200.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Identifier of user to retrieve activities for

parameters.name: fromTimestamp
parameters.description: Limit to activities created after this epoch timestamp.

get.description: Exports the `draft` version of a table to CSV / EXCEL format.

parameters.name: tableIdOrName
parameters.description: The ID or name of the table to export.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The file format to export. Possible values include `CSV`, `XLSX`, and `XLS`.

get.description: Returns the details for each draft table defined in the specified account, including column definitions.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Specifies which fields to use for sorting results. Valid fields are `name`, `createdAt`, `updatedAt`, `createdBy`, `updatedBy`. `createdAt` will be used by default.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The cursor token value to get the next set of results. You can get this from the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return. Default is 1000.

parameters.name: createdAt
parameters.description: Only return tables created at exactly the specified time.

parameters.name: createdAfter
parameters.description: Only return tables created after the specified time.

parameters.name: createdBefore
parameters.description: Only return tables created before the specified time.

parameters.name: updatedAt
parameters.description: Only return tables last updated at exactly the specified time.

parameters.name: updatedAfter
parameters.description: Only return tables last updated after the specified time.

parameters.name: updatedBefore
parameters.description: Only return tables last updated before the specified time.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Specifies whether to return archived tables. Defaults to `false`.

get.description:
Get a single row by ID from a table's `published` version.
**Note:** This endpoint can be accessed without any authentication, if the table is set to be allowed for public access.

parameters.name: tableIdOrName
parameters.description: The ID or name of the table

parameters.name: rowId
parameters.description: The ID of the row

get.description: Returns rows in the `draft` version of the specified table. Row results can be filtered and sorted. Filtering and sorting options will be sent as query parameters to the API request. For example, by adding the query parameters `column1__gt=5&sort=-column1`, API returns the rows with values for column `column1` greater than 5 and in the descending order of `column1` values. Refer to the [overview section](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/api/cms/hubdb#filtering-and-sorting-table-rows) for detailed filtering and sorting options.

parameters.name: tableIdOrName
parameters.description: The ID or name of the table to query.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Specifies the column names to sort the results by.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The cursor token value to get the next set of results. You can get this from the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return. Default is `1000`.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: Specify the column names to get results containing only the required columns instead of all column details. If you want to include multiple columns in the result, use this query param as many times.

post.description: Clones a single row in the `draft` version of the table.

parameters.name: tableIdOrName
parameters.description: The ID or name of the table

parameters.name: rowId
parameters.description: The ID of the row

get.summary: Export a published version of a table
get.description: Exports the `published` version of a table to CSV / EXCEL format.

parameters.name: tableIdOrName
parameters.description: The ID or name of the table to export.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The file format to export. Possible values include `CSV`, `XLSX`, and `XLS`.

post.description: Replaces the data in the `draft` version of the table with values from the `published` version. Any unpublished changes in the `draft` will be lost after this call is made.

parameters.name: tableIdOrName
parameters.description: The ID or name of the table to reset.

parameters.name: includeForeignIds
parameters.description: Set this to `true` to populate foreign ID values in the response.

post.summary: Replace rows in batch in draft table
post.description: Replaces multiple rows as a batch in the `draft` version of the table, with a maximum of 100 rows per call. See the endpoint `PUT /tables/{tableIdOrName}/rows/{rowId}/draft` for details on updating a single row.

parameters.name: tableIdOrName
parameters.description: The ID or name of the table

post.description: Clone an existing HubDB table. The `newName` and `newLabel` of the new table can be sent as JSON in the `body` parameter. This will create the cloned table as a `draft`.

parameters.name: tableIdOrName
parameters.description: The ID or name of the table to clone.

requestBody.description: JSON object with the properties newName and newLabel. You can set copyRows to false to clone the table with copying rows and default is true.

post.description: Permanently deletes rows from the `draft` version of the table, given a set of row ids. Maximum of 100 row ids per call.

parameters.name: tableIdOrName
parameters.description: The ID or name of the table

post.description:
Import the contents of a CSV file into an existing HubDB table. The data will always be imported into the `draft` version of the table. Use `/publish` endpoint to push these changes to `published` version.
This endpoint takes a multi-part POST request. The first part will be a set of JSON-formatted options for the import and you can specify this with the name as `config`.  The second part will be the CSV file you want to import and you can specify this with the name as `file`. Refer the [overview section](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/api/cms/hubdb#importing-tables) to check the details and format of the JSON-formatted options for the import.

parameters.name: tableIdOrName
parameters.description: The ID of the destination table where data will be imported.

config.description: Configuration for the import in JSON format as described above.

file.description: The source CSV file to be imported.

get.summary: Get a row from the draft table
get.description: Get a single row by ID from a table's `draft` version.

parameters.name: tableIdOrName
parameters.description: The ID or name of the table

parameters.name: rowId
parameters.description: The ID of the row

put.description:
Replace a single row in the table's `draft` version.
All the column values must be specified. If a column has a value in the target table and this request doesn't define that value, it will be deleted.
See the `Create a row` endpoint for instructions on how to format the JSON row definitions.

parameters.name: tableIdOrName
parameters.description: The ID or name of the table

parameters.name: rowId
parameters.description: The ID of the row

requestBody.description: The JSON object of the row

delete.description: Permanently deletes a row from a table's `draft` version.

parameters.name: tableIdOrName
parameters.description: The ID or name of the table

parameters.name: rowId
parameters.description: The ID of the row

patch.description:
Sparse updates a single row in the table's `draft` version.
All the column values need not be specified. Only the columns or fields that needs to be modified can be specified.
See the `Create a row` endpoint for instructions on how to format the JSON row definitions.

parameters.name: tableIdOrName
parameters.description: The ID or name of the table

parameters.name: rowId
parameters.description: The ID of the row

requestBody.description: The JSON object of the row with necessary fields that needs to be updated.

get.description:
Returns a set of rows in the `published` version of the specified table. Row results can be filtered and sorted. Filtering and sorting options will be sent as query parameters to the API request. For example, by adding the query parameters `column1__gt=5&sort=-column1`, API returns the rows with values for column `column1` greater than 5 and in the descending order of `column1` values. Refer to the [overview section](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/api/cms/hubdb#filtering-and-sorting-table-rows) for detailed filtering and sorting options.
**Note:** This endpoint can be accessed without any authentication, if the table is set to be allowed for public access.

parameters.name: tableIdOrName
parameters.description: The ID or name of the table to query.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Specifies the column names to sort the results by. See the above description for more details.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The cursor token value to get the next set of results. You can get this from the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return. Default is `1000`.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: Specify the column names to get results containing only the required columns instead of all column details.

post.summary: Add a new row to a table
post.description: Add a new row to a HubDB table. New rows will be added to the `draft` version of the table. Use `publish` endpoint to push these changes to published version.

parameters.name: tableIdOrName
parameters.description: The ID or name of the target table.

requestBody.description: The row definition JSON, formatted as described above.

post.description:
Returns rows in the `published` version of the specified table, given a set of row ids.
**Note:** This endpoint can be accessed without any authentication if the table is set to be allowed for public access.

parameters.name: tableIdOrName
parameters.description: The ID or name of the table to query.

requestBody.description: The JSON array of row ids

post.description: Creates rows in the `draft` version of the specified table, given an array of row objects. Maximum of 100 row object per call. See the overview section for more details with an example.

parameters.name: tableIdOrName
parameters.description: The ID or name of the table

get.summary: Get details for a published table
get.description:
Returns the details for the `published` version of the specified table. This will include the definitions for the columns in the table and the number of rows in the table.

**Note:** This endpoint can be accessed without any authentication if the table is set to be allowed for public access.

parameters.name: tableIdOrName
parameters.description: The ID or name of the table to return.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Set this to `true` to return details for an archived table. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: includeForeignIds
parameters.description: Set this to `true` to populate foreign ID values in the result.

delete.description: Archive (soft delete) an existing HubDB table. This archives both the published and draft versions.

parameters.name: tableIdOrName
parameters.description: The ID or name of the table to archive.

post.summary: Get a set of rows from draft table
post.description: Returns rows in the `draft` version of the specified table, given a set of row ids.

parameters.name: tableIdOrName
parameters.description: The ID or name of the table

post.description: Clones rows in the `draft` version of the specified table, given a set of row ids. Maximum of 100 row ids per call.

parameters.name: tableIdOrName
parameters.description: The ID or name of the table

requestBody.description: The JSON array of row ids

get.description: Returns the details for the `published` version of each table defined in an account, including column definitions.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Specifies which fields to use for sorting results. Valid fields are `name`, `createdAt`, `updatedAt`, `createdBy`, `updatedBy`. `createdAt` will be used by default.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The cursor token value to get the next set of results. You can get this from the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return. Default is 1000.

parameters.name: createdAt
parameters.description: Only return tables created at exactly the specified time.

parameters.name: createdAfter
parameters.description: Only return tables created after the specified time.

parameters.name: createdBefore
parameters.description: Only return tables created before the specified time.

parameters.name: updatedAt
parameters.description: Only return tables last updated at exactly the specified time.

parameters.name: updatedAfter
parameters.description: Only return tables last updated after the specified time.

parameters.name: updatedBefore
parameters.description: Only return tables last updated before the specified time.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Specifies whether to return archived tables. Defaults to `false`.

post.description: Creates a new draft HubDB table given a JSON schema. The table name and label should be unique for each account.

requestBody.description: The JSON schema for the table being created.

post.description: Unpublishes the table, meaning any website pages using data from the table will not render any data.

parameters.name: tableIdOrName
parameters.description: The ID or name of the table to publish.

parameters.name: includeForeignIds
parameters.description: Set this to `true` to populate foreign ID values in the response.

post.description: Publishes the table by copying the data and table schema changes from draft version to the published version, meaning any website pages using data from the table will be updated.

parameters.name: tableIdOrName
parameters.description: The ID or name of the table to publish.

parameters.name: includeForeignIds
parameters.description: Set this to `true` to populate foreign ID values in the response.

get.summary: Get details for a draft table
get.description: Get the details for the `draft` version of a specific HubDB table. This will include the definitions for the columns in the table and the number of rows in the table.

parameters.name: tableIdOrName
parameters.description: The ID or name of the table to return.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Set this to `true` to return an archived table. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: includeForeignIds
parameters.description: Set this to `true` to populate foreign ID values in the result.

patch.description:
Update an existing HubDB table. You can use this endpoint to add or remove columns to the table as well as restore an archived table. Tables updated using the endpoint will only modify the `draft` verion of the table. Use `publish` endpoint to push all the changes to the `published` version. To restore a table, include the query parameter `archived=true` and `"archived": false` in the json body.
**Note:** You need to include all the columns in the input when you are adding/removing/updating a column. If you do not include an already existing column in the request, it will be deleted.

parameters.name: tableIdOrName
parameters.description: The ID or name of the table to update.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Specifies whether to return archived tables. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: includeForeignIds
parameters.description: Set this to `true` to populate foreign ID values in the result.

requestBody.description: The JSON schema for the table being updated.

post.summary: Update rows in batch in draft table
post.description: Updates multiple rows as a batch in the `draft` version of the table, with a maximum of 100 rows per call. See the endpoint `PATCH /tables/{tableIdOrName}/rows/{rowId}/draft` for details on updating a single row.

parameters.name: tableIdOrName
parameters.description: The ID or name of the table

regionCode.description: The approximate region code of the login

countryCode.description: The approximate country code of the login

ipAddress.description: IP address where the activity originated.

userAgent.description: Information about the device used for logging in.

loginAt.description: The time the login took place.

email.description: Email address of the user associated with the login.

loginSucceeded.description: Whether the login was successful or not.

PublicLoginAudit.description: Details about the a particular login activity for a HubSpot account.

newName.description: The new name for the cloned table

newLabel.description: The new label for the cloned table

copyRows.description: Specifies whether to copy the rows during clone

code.description: The status code associated with the error detail

in.description: The name of the field or parameter in which the error was found.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

options.description: Options to choose for select and multi-select columns

columns.description: List of columns in the table

rowCount.description: Number of rows in the table

useForPages.description: Specifies whether the table can be used for creation of dynamic pages

allowChildTables.description: Specifies whether child tables can be created

enableChildTablePages.description: Specifies creation of multi-level dynamic pages using child tables

dynamicMetaTags.description: Specifies the key value pairs of the metadata fields with the associated column ids

allowPublicApiAccess.description: Specifies whether the table can be read by public without authorization

createdAt.description: Timestamp at which the table is created

publishedAt.description: Timestamp at which the table is published recently

updatedAt.description: Timestamp at which the table is updated recently

rowLimitExceeded.description: Specifies whether row limit exceeded during import

createdAt.description: The time the activity took place.

actingUser.description: Email address of the user associated with the activity.

infoUrl.description: A link to the URL where the action was taken in the account.

ipAddress.description: IP address where the activity originated.

objectId.description: The ID of the affected object.

HydratedCriticalAction.description: Details about the a particular security activity for a HubSpot account.

useForPages.description: Specifies whether the table can be used for creation of dynamic pages

allowPublicApiAccess.description: Specifies whether the table can be read by public without authorization

allowChildTables.description: Specifies whether child tables can be created

enableChildTablePages.description: Specifies creation of multi-level dynamic pages using child tables

columns.description: List of columns in the table

dynamicMetaTags.description: Specifies the key value pairs of the metadata fields with the associated column ids

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

correlationId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

links.description: A map of link names to associated URIs containing documentation about the error or recommended remediation steps

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

example.message: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)

options.description: Options to choose for select and multi-select columns

foreignTableId.description: The id of another table to which the column refers/points to.

foreignColumnId.description: The id of the column from another table to which the column refers/points to.

collectedAt.description: Indicates when the cache was last updated.

usageLimit.description: Limits by which a single integration can consume the HubSpot public APIs.

fetchStatus.description: Status of fetching the information, including if the data came from the cache.

currentUsage.description: How many API calls an account has made for the current day.

resetsAt.description: Time that the limit will reset.

ApiUsage.description: API usage and limits information for a HubSpot account.

path.description: Specifies the value for `hs_path` column, which will be used as slug in the dynamic pages

name.description: Specifies the value for `hs_name` column, which will be used as title in the dynamic pages

childTableId.description: Specifies the value for the column child table id

values.description: List of key value pairs with the column name and column value

id.description: The id of the table row
